column5: does anyone know of a reputable outboard mechanic/parts dealer in the London area? I've heard bade marine in pt franks is good but not sure of any others around here closer that have a good reputation.
Have no idea about rep,but isnt there one just off the 401 out there? I seen it on my travels when I go for my robotics training..
There is pier 74 out in niles town don't know anything about them. Hully gully isn't far from 401 but not interested in going there....
Rob from Extreme Marine has joined in with pier 74 in Nilestown. Rob is a good guy and has always treated me right.
It had never been recommended to me for service...I'll leave it at that.  Anyone else know of someone around here? Few and far between
How far are you willing to drive? I have had great luck and great service from Massel's Marine in New Hamburg (45 min drive from London). Really good guys.
You are a man of few words, member since '06....and finally a post. Welcome to the board.
Guilty as charged. Guess I've been lurking too long. I will introduce myself properly in a separate post so as to not hijack this one.
Wow looks like I'm going for a drive. Not even any parts dealers locally that have fair pricing?
Can Do Sports south of Woodstock has treated me fairly.
I am not aware of anything (other than Hully Gully) in the immediate area since General Marine (downtown) and another that I can't recall the name of, on Oxford St east, shut down.
try ships ahoy marine just outside St.Thomas they are a certified omc service shop.
In Chatham, there is Howell's Marine.  They are Certified Mercury Master Mechanics.  They will take care of you.  Brian
